intro: Aria mougeotii var. typica, commonly known as the typical form of the genus Aria, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
